name: places/ChIJPyJw8oRYwokRPcuMD4AZtSM
formattedAddress: 145 W 86th St # 1A, New York, NY 10024, USA
adrFormatAddress: 145 W 86th St # 1A, New York, NY 10024, USA

originalText.text: After being told, very matter of factly, on September 6, 2023 by Dr. Jane Taylor that the psoriasis  on my arms and legs was too far gone for her to treat , I was extremely surprised and disappointed.  She referred me to another doctor who doesn't take any insurance and charges $250-350 an hour!  I am a singer and my appearance is important to me.  The psoriasis has been a huge source of grief for me and was getting worse.  I am not one to quit so I did some research and found Dr. Friedler who is kind, patient, brilliant and beautiful person inside and out, I had my first consultation with her on September 28, 2023 and she said "this isn't bad at all, I've seen much worse, this is totally treatable!" I believed her and, for the first time in a long time, felt extremely optimistic.  It is now three months later and my psoriasis is almost completely gone.  My skin is soft to touch and healthy looking.  I am ever so grateful to Dr. Friedler and would recommend her to anyone who is having skin issues.  I am pleased with the staff as well.

originalText.text: Dr Friedler is not a good doctor. She’s passive aggressive, straight up mean and does not listen to her patients. She’s also directly demeaning to her staff, who are very nice and trying their best. Not to mention you have to wait an hour every time you go. After 3 different visits of not being listened to, I’m done. Never coming back and highly recommend you stay far away.

text.text: Dr Friedler is not a good doctor. She’s passive aggressive, straight up mean and does not listen to her patients. After 3 different visits of not being listened to, I’m done. Never coming back and highly recommend you stay far away.

originalText.text:
I've been seeing Dr. Friedler did a few years, and saw her again today. I had to wait a little, but it was my own fault for being late; she came to the waiting room door herself while I was checking in to see if she had patients there, so she finished with them first.

Anyway, when Dr. Friedler did come into the examination room, she spent a very long time with me. She thoroughly discussed every one of my issues and concerns, and varieties of treatments that included OTC solutions. She couldn't have been kinder or more informative. She also shared personal details that displayed her genuine empathy.

BTW, I saw examples of her cosmetic work and it's stunning. Totally natural looking, not "done", but enhanced and refreshed. Even the lip fillers looked natural, and that's the acid test. I've never even considered injectables before because they usually look awful, but now? Strong possibility.

originalText.text: My doctor explained everything she did and was gentle and caring and professional. The nurses and receptionists all seemed to enjoy each other’s company so there was a positive, upbeat feeling in the office. It was the best possible scenario for a potentially dreadful procedure and I am grateful to all involved.

text.text: My doctor explained everything she did and was gentle and caring and professional. The nurses and receptionists all seemed to enjoy each other’s company so there was a positive, upbeat feeling in the office. It was the best possible scenario for a potentially dreadful procedure and I am grateful to all involved.

originalText.text:
I personally was disappointed because there was a long wait despite my appointment, I was Informed the procedure I need is cosmetic only and that even though my health insurance told me my medically necessary botox needs were covered, that this wasn't true. (I have a chronic eye twitch.)
I was also upsold a bleaching cream (which admittedly I DO need) but they were out of stock and lost the sale.
The doctor was really nice but my experience was kind of lame. I don't see myself returning.
